definition: straight/to straighten/fair and reasonable/frank/straightforward/(indicates continuing motion or action)/vertical/vertical downward stroke in Chinese characters
surname Zhi/Zhi (c. 2000 BC), fifth of the legendary Flame Emperors 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God

sentences.english: She played the piano, the violin and, in her later years, the recorder.
sentences.chinese: 她彈鋼琴，拉提琴，晚年還吹八孔直笛。

sentences.english: She played the piano, the violin and in her later years, the recorder.
sentences.chinese: 她彈鋼琴，拉小提琴，晚年時還吹八孔直笛。

definition: hulusi, aka cucurbit flute (a kind of free reed wind instrument)
bawu, a free reed wind instrument shaped like a flute and played transversally, associated particularly with minority cultures of Yunnan
zhongruan or alto lute, like pipa 琵琶 but bigger and lower range
zither or guzheng/large zither with 13 to 25 strings, developed from guqin 古琴[gu3 qin2] during Tang and Song times
musical ensemble of several instruments (e.g. duet 二重奏 or trio 三重奏)
